Fahri Hamzah : Pak Menteri, Negara Tidak Menugaskanmu untuk Mengurusi Orang Pakai Baju
01 Nov 2019, 21:03 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


Fahri Hamzah : Pak Menteri, Negara Tidak Menugaskanmu untuk Mengurusi Orang Pakai Baju

KBRN, Jakarta : Mantan Wakil Ketua DPR RI, Fahri Hamzah mengkritisi tentang wacana pelarangan penggunaan cadar dan celana cingkrang di instansi Kementerian Agama. Wacana tersebut dilontarkan oleh Menteri Agama, Fachrul Razi.Menurut Fahri, mestinya sebagai menteri, Fahcrul mestinya memperbaiki kinerja kementerian yang dikenal masih buruk kinerjanya itu."Pak Menteri yth,Tugas prioritasmu memperbaiki lembaga yang dikenal masih buruk kinerjanya dan korup," seru Fahri dalam akun Twitter pribadinya, @FahriHamzah, Jumat (1/11/2019).Pasalnya ditegaskan Fahri, negara menugaskan seorang menteri untuk memperbaiki kinerja kementerian yang dipimpinnya tersebut. Bukan malah mengurusi pakaian dari orang-orang yang memasuki area kantor kementeriannya."Negara tidak menugaskanmu untukÂ  mengurus cara orang pakai baju. Baju itu pilihan privat. Evolusi cara orang berpakaian itu komplek. Dan negara gak usah ikut campur," tukas Fahri menegaskan. (Foto : Tangkap Layar Talk Show TV One)

Fahri Hamzah: Mr. Minister, the State Doesn't Assign You to Take Care of People Wearing Clothes
01 Nov 2019, 21:03 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


Fahri Hamzah: Mr. Minister, the State Doesn't Assign You to Take Care of People Wearing Clothes

KBRN, Jakarta: Former Deputy Speaker of the Indonesian House of Representatives, Fahri Hamzah, criticized the discourse to ban the use of veils and pants for the Ministry of Religion. The discourse was raised by the Minister of Religion, Fachrul Razi. According to Fahri, supposedly as a minister, Fahcrul should improve the performance of ministries known for their poor performance. his personal Twitter account, @ Fahri Hamzah, Friday (11/01/2019). As Fahri confirmed, the country assigned a minister to improve the performance of the ministry he leads. "The state does not assign you to take care of the way people wear clothes. Clothes are a private choice. The evolution of the way people dress is complex. And the state does not need to interfere," Fahri said. (Photo: Screenshot of Talk Show TV One)
